fields.value: Consolidated Federal Funds Report (CFFR), Fiscal Year 1985

authorName.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Commerce. Bureau of the Census

dsDescriptionValue.value:
These data describe federal expenditures or obligations for   the following categories: grants, salari
es and wages, procurement   contracts, direct payments for individuals, other direct payments,   direct loans, guaranteed or insured loans, and insurance. Dollar   amounts reported represent actual expenditures or obligations. The CFFR   Data File includes the government identification code, program   identification code, object/assistance type code, amount in whole   dollars, and FIPS code. For each unique government unit code, all   programs are listed and for each program, all records with different   object categories are listed. The CFFR Geographic Reference File   contains the names and governmental unit codes for all state, county   and subcounty areas in the United States. In addition, the file   provides associated geographic codes (FIPS, GSA, and Census Bureau   place codes), the 1984 population, and the congressional districts   serving each governmental unit. The CFFR Program Identification File   supplies program identification codes and their respective program  titles.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR VIII.C. Governmental Structures, Policies, and Capabilities, Statistics on Government Operations

fields.value: Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18Version Date: 2006-01-18Version Text: 2006-01-18 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: File CB8614.PDF was removed from any previous datasets and flagged as a study-level file, so that it will accompany all downloads.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Certain categories of federal government spending have   been intentionally excluded. These include such items as interest on   federal government debt, travel expenses when not provided under   contract, and international payments and foreign aid. Expenditures for   the Central Intelligence Agency and the National Security Agency are  also excluded.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Data file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Data were obtained from reporting systems of various   federal government agencies including the Office of Personnel   Management, the Department of Defense, the Postal Service, the  Department of Labor, and the Department of the Treasury.
Federal government expenditures or obligations in state,   county, and subcounty areas of the United States. The District of  Columbia and United States territories are also included.
